content: The Act titled "Early Hearing Detection and Intervention Act of 2006" focuses on early detection, diagnosis, and treatment of hearing loss. Section 399M of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 280g-1) is amended to include newborns, infants, and young children in hearing screening, evaluation, diagnosis, and intervention programs. This expands the scope to assist in recruiting, retaining, educating, and training qualified personnel and healthcare providers. The Public Health Service Act is amended to include newborns, infants, and young children in hearing screening and intervention programs.
